prompt.p: A 54-year-old with type 2 diabetes is in recovery immediately after a right total hip replacement for which he had a spinal anaesthetic. He normally takes metformin 500 mg t.i.d. and amlodipine 10 mg OD for high blood pressure. He had been started on sliding scale insulin preoperatively and is due for discharge to the ward.
What is the most appropriate management strategy at this point?

choiceInteraction.simpleChoice: Continue sliding scale insulin for next 24 hours
Give usual medication with next meal
Keep nil by mouth for next 24 hours

modalFeedback.p: Option C is Correct. The IV insulin should be discontinued and the patient fed.
Option A is Incorrect. This patient no longer needs to be nil by mouth and therefore can be switched back onto diet and his usual medications.
Option B is Incorrect. This is not required and unnecessarily complex.
Option D is Incorrect. This is not required.
Option E is Incorrect. This is inappropriate.
